verses.verse: At that time <WG2540> Jesus <WG2424> went <WG4198> on the Sabbath <WG4521> through <WG1223> the grainfields, <WG4702> and His disciples <WG3101> became hungry <WG3983> and began <WG757> to pick <WG5089> the heads <WG4719> [of grain] and eat. <WG2068>

But when the Pharisees <WG5330> saw <WG3708> it, they said <WG3004> to Him, "Behold, <WG2400> Your disciples <WG3101> do <WG4160> what <WG3739> is not lawful <WG1832> to do <WG4160> on a Sabbath. <WG4521>"
But He said <WG3004> to them, "Have you not read <WG314> what <WG5101> David <WG7035> did, <WG4160> when <WG3753> he became hungry, <WG3983> he and his companions <WG3588>; <WG3326>

how <WG4459> he entered <WG1525> the house <WG3624> of God, <WG2316> and they ate <WG2068> the consecrated <WG4286> bread, <WG740> which <WG3739> was not lawful <WG1832> for him to eat, <WG2068> nor <WG3761> for those <WG3588> with him, but for the priests <WG2409> alone <WG3441>?
"Or <WG2228> have you not read <WG314> in the Law, <WG3551> that on the Sabbath <WG4521> the priests <WG2409> in the temple <WG2413> break <WG953> the Sabbath, <WG4521> and are innocent <WG338>?
"But I say <WG3004> to you, that something greater <WG3173> than the temple <WG2413> is here. <WG5602>

"But if <WG1487> you had known <WG1097> what <WG5101> this means, <WG1510> 'I desire <WG2309> compassion, <WG1656> and not a sacrifice, <WG2378>' you would not have condemned <WG2613> the innocent. <WG338>
"For the Son <WG5207> of Man <WG444> is Lord <WG2962> of the Sabbath. <WG4521>"
And departing <WG3327> from there, <WG1564> He went <WG2064> into their synagogue. <WG4864>

And behold, <WG2400> [there was] a man <WG444> with a withered <WG3584> hand. <WG5495> And they questioned <WG1905> Him, saying, <WG3004> "Is it lawful <WG1832> to heal <WG2323> on the Sabbath <WG4521>?" â€“ in order <WG2443> that they might accuse <WG2723> Him.

And He said <WG3004> to them, "What <WG5101> man <WG444> shall there be among <WG1537> you, who <WG3739> shall have <WG2192> one <WG1520> sheep, <WG4263> and if <WG1437> it falls <WG1706> into a pit <WG999> on the Sabbath, <WG4521> will he not take <WG2902> hold <WG2902> of it, and lift <WG1453> it out?

"Of how <WG4214> much <WG4214> more <WG1308> value <WG1308> then <WG3767> is a man <WG444> than a sheep! <WG4263> So <WG5620> then, <WG5620> it is lawful <WG1832> to do <WG4160> good <WG2573> on the Sabbath. <WG4521>"

Then <WG5119> He said <WG3004> to the man, <WG444> "Stretch <WG1614> out your hand! <WG5495>" And he stretched <WG1614> it out, and it was restored <WG600> to normal, <WG5199> like <WG5613> the other. <WG243>
But the Pharisees <WG5330> went <WG1831> out, and counseled <WG4824> <WG2983> together <WG4824> against <WG2596> Him, [as to] how <WG3704> they might destroy <WG622> Him.
But Jesus, <WG2424> aware <WG1097> of [this,] withdrew <WG402> from there. <WG1564> And many <WG4183> followed <WG190> Him, and He healed <WG2323> them all, <WG3956>
and warned <WG2008> them not to make <WG4160> Him known, <WG5318>
in order <WG2443> that what <WG3588> was spoken <WG3004> through <WG1223> Isaiah <WG2268> the prophet, <WG4396> might be fulfilled, <WG4137> saying, <WG3004>

"Behold, <WG2400> My Servant <WG3816> whom <WG3739> I have chosen; <WG140> My Beloved <WG27> in whom <WG3739> My soul <WG5590> is well-pleased; I will put <WG5087> My Spirit <WG4151> upon Him, And He shall proclaim <WG518> justice <WG2920> to the Gentiles. <WG1484>
"He will not quarrel, <WG2051> nor <WG3761> cry <WG2905> out; Nor <WG3761> will anyone <WG5100> hear <WG191> His voice <WG5456> in the streets. <WG4116>

"A battered <WG4937> reed <WG2563> He will not break <WG2608> off, And a smoldering <WG5188> wick <WG3043> He will not put <WG4570> out, Until <WG2193> He leads <WG1544> justice <WG2920> to victory. <WG3534>
"And in His name <WG3686> the Gentiles <WG1484> will hope. <WG1679>"

Then <WG5119> there was brought <WG4374> to Him a demon-possessed man [who was] blind <WG5185> and dumb, <WG2974> and He healed <WG2323> him, so <WG5620> that the dumb <WG2974> man <WG2974> spoke <WG2980> and saw. <WG991>
And all <WG3956> the multitudes <WG3793> were amazed, <WG1839> and [began] to say, <WG3004> "This <WG3778> [man] cannot <WG3385> be the Son <WG5207> of David, <WG7035> can he?"

But when the Pharisees <WG5330> heard <WG191> it, they said, <WG3004> "This <WG3778> man <WG3778> casts <WG1544> out demons <WG1140> only <WG3756> <WG1487> <WG3361> by Beelzebul <WG954> the ruler <WG758> of the demons. <WG1140>"

And knowing <WG3609> their thoughts <WG1761> He said <WG3004> to them, "Any <WG3956> kingdom <WG932> divided <WG3307> against <WG2596> itself <WG1438> is laid <WG2049> waste; <WG2049> and any <WG3956> city <WG4172> or <WG2228> house <WG3614> divided <WG3307> against <WG2596> itself <WG1438> shall not stand <WG2476>.
"And if <WG1487> Satan <WG4567> casts <WG1544> out Satan, <WG4567> he is divided <WG3307> against <WG1909> himself; <WG1438> how <WG4459> then <WG3767> shall his kingdom <WG932> stand <WG2476>?

"And if <WG1487> I by Beelzebul <WG954> cast <WG1544> out demons, <WG1140> by whom <WG5101> do your sons <WG5207> cast <WG1544> them out? Consequently <WG1223> <WG3778> they shall be your judges. <WG2923>
"But if <WG1487> I cast <WG1544> out demons <WG1140> by the Spirit <WG4151> of God, <WG2316> then <WG686> the kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> has come <WG5348> upon you.

"Or <WG2228> how <WG4459> can <WG1410> anyone <WG5100> enter <WG1525> the strong <WG2478> man's house <WG3614> and carry <WG726> off <WG726> his property, <WG4632> unless <WG1437> <WG3361> he first <WG4413> binds <WG1210> the strong <WG2478> [man]? And then <WG5119> he will plunder <WG1283> his house. <WG3614>
"He who is not with Me is against <WG2596> Me; and he who does not gather <WG4863> with Me scatters. <WG4650>

"Therefore <WG1223> <WG3778> I say <WG3004> to you, any <WG3956> sin <WG266> and blasphemy <WG988> shall be forgiven <WG863> men, <WG444> but blasphemy <WG988> against the Spirit <WG4151> shall not be forgiven. <WG863>

"And whoever <WG3739> <WG1437> shall speak <WG3004> a word <WG3056> against <WG2596> the Son <WG5207> of Man, <WG444> it shall be forgiven <WG863> him; but whoever <WG3739> <WG302> shall speak <WG3004> against <WG2596> the Holy <WG40> Spirit, <WG4151> it shall not be forgiven <WG863> him, either <WG3777> in this <WG3778> age, <WG165> or <WG3777> in the [age] to come. <WG3195>

"Either <WG2228> make <WG4160> the tree <WG1186> good, <WG2570> and its fruit <WG2590> good; <WG2570> or <WG2228> make <WG4160> the tree <WG1186> bad, <WG4550> and its fruit <WG2590> bad; <WG4550> for the tree <WG1186> is known <WG1097> by its fruit. <WG2590>

"You brood <WG1081> of vipers, <WG2191> how <WG4459> can <WG1410> you, being <WG1510> evil, <WG4190> speak <WG2980> what is good <WG18>? For the mouth <WG4750> speaks <WG2980> out of that which <WG4051> fills <WG4051> the heart. <WG2588>

"The good <WG18> man <WG444> out of [his] good <WG18> treasure <WG2344> brings <WG1544> forth <WG1544> what is good; <WG18> and the evil <WG4190> man <WG444> out of [his] evil <WG4190> treasure <WG2344> brings <WG1544> forth <WG1544> what is evil. <WG4190>

"And I say <WG3004> to you, that every <WG3956> careless <WG692> word <WG4487> that men <WG444> shall speak, <WG2980> they shall render <WG591> account <WG3056> for it in the day <WG2250> of judgment. <WG2920>
"For by your words <WG3056> you shall be justified, <WG1344> and by your words <WG3056> you shall be condemned. <WG2613>"
Then <WG5119> some <WG5100> of the scribes <WG1122> and Pharisees <WG5330> answered <WG611> Him, saying, <WG3004> "Teacher, <WG1320> we want <WG2309> to see <WG3708> a sign <WG4592> from You."

But He answered <WG611> and said <WG3004> to them, "An evil <WG4190> and adulterous <WG3428> generation <WG1074> craves <WG1934> for a sign; <WG4592> and [yet] no <WG3756> sign <WG4592> shall be given <WG1325> to it but the sign <WG4592> of Jonah <WG2495> the prophet; <WG4396>

for just <WG5618> as Jonah <WG2495> was three <WG5140> days <WG2250> and three <WG5140> nights <WG3571> in the belly <WG2836> of the sea <WG2785> monster, <WG2785> so <WG3779> shall the Son <WG5207> of Man <WG444> be three <WG5140> days <WG2250> and three <WG5140> nights <WG3571> in the heart <WG2588> of the earth. <WG1093>

"The men <WG435> of Nineveh <WG3536> shall stand <WG450> up with this <WG3778> generation <WG1074> at the judgment, <WG2920> and shall condemn <WG2632> it because <WG3754> they repented <WG3340> at the preaching <WG2782> of Jonah; <WG2495> and behold, <WG2400> something greater <WG4183> than Jonah <WG2495> is here. <WG5602>

"[The] Queen <WG938> of [the] South <WG3558> shall rise <WG1453> up with this <WG3778> generation <WG1074> at the judgment <WG2920> and shall condemn <WG2632> it, because <WG3754> she came <WG2064> from the ends <WG4009> of the earth <WG1093> to hear <WG191> the wisdom <WG4678> of Solomon; <WG4672> and behold, <WG2400> something greater <WG4183> than Solomon <WG4672> is here. <WG5602>

"Now <WG1161> when <WG3752> the unclean <WG169> spirit <WG4151> goes <WG1831> out of a man, <WG444> it passes <WG1330> through <WG1223> waterless <WG504> places, <WG5117> seeking <WG2212> rest, <WG372> and does not find <WG2147> [it.]

"Then <WG5119> it says, <WG3004> 'I will return <WG1994> to my house <WG3624> from which <WG3606> I came <WG1831>'; and when it comes, <WG2064> it finds <WG2147> it unoccupied, <WG4980> swept, <WG4563> and put <WG2885> in order. <WG2885>

"Then <WG5119> it goes, <WG4198> and takes <WG3880> along <WG3880> with it seven <WG2033> other <WG2087> spirits <WG4151> more <WG4190> wicked <WG4190> than itself, <WG1438> and they go <WG1525> in and live <WG2730> there; <WG1563> and the last <WG2078> state of that man <WG444> becomes <WG1096> worse <WG5501> than the first. <WG4413> That is the way <WG3779> it will also <WG2532> be with this <WG3778> evil <WG4190> generation. <WG1074>"

While He was still <WG2089> speaking <WG2980> to the multitudes, <WG3793> behold, <WG2400> His mother <WG3384> and brothers <WG80> were standing <WG2476> outside, <WG1854> seeking <WG2212> to speak <WG2980> to Him.
And someone <WG5100> said <WG3004> to Him, "Behold, <WG2400> Your mother <WG3384> and Your brothers <WG80> are standing <WG2476> outside <WG1854> seeking <WG2212> to speak <WG2980> to You."
But He answered <WG611> the one who was telling <WG3004> Him and said, <WG3004> "Who <WG5101> is My mother <WG3384> and who <WG5101> are My brothers <WG80>?"
And stretching <WG1614> out His hand <WG5495> toward <WG1909> His disciples, <WG3101> He said, <WG3004> "Behold, <WG2400> My mother <WG3384> and My brothers! <WG80>
"For whoever <WG3748> <WG302> does <WG4160> the will <WG2307> of My Father <WG3962> who is in heaven, <WG3772> he is My brother <WG80> and sister <WG79> and mother. <WG3384>"
